author: Brian Weiss
title: 10 things to do this weekend
text:
6. Shocktober in Irvington 
Oct. 16, 8 p.m. This celebration of scary cinema is perfectly suited for the historically haunted neighborhood of Irvington. This spooky one-night event will showcase a slew of Hoosier-made horror films, including director Dan T. Hallâ€™s Central State: Asylum for the Insane. The producers of The Obsessive Viewer podcast will be there to host Q&A sessions with the local filmmakers and raffle off prizes throughout the night. All proceeds go directly to the Irvington Historical Society. 
7. Ale Yeah! 
Oct. 17, 2 p..m. If you've missed the plethora of beer festivals the past month, you've got another chance. Enjoy an afternoon of beer sampling courtesy of some of finest brewers around town. City Market vendors will be open to serve you up your favorite snacks. 
8. Lewis Black 
Oct. 17, 8 p.m. This Grammy Award-winning stand-up comedian is one of the most prolific and popular performers working today. He executes a brilliant trifecta as a stand-up comedian, actor and author. His live performances provide a cathartic release of anger and disillusionment for his audience. Alex Farris 
9. Optical Popsicle: Infinity 
Oct. 17, 3 p.m., 8 p.m. A mish-mash of puppets, video, live music and dance come together for one unpredictable night of whimsy. Optical Popsicle features the assorted imaginations of Know No Stranger members as well as the faraway talents of performance artists and videographers from across the Midwest.
